thread.title: New New York
thread.title_full: New New York | The Sunday Times

author: The Sunday Times Travel Magazine
title: New New York
text:
Last time: You did brunch
This time: Get up for breakfast Why? New York City is all about fads, and right now, everybody who’s anybody is eating breakfast: the foodie bible Zagat recently ran an article entitled Why Breakfast Is the Meal of the Moment. It suits your British body clock perfectly — anyone waking at 5am, jet-lagged and starving, deserves hash browns, bacon and a bloody mary. (The one at the Loeb Boathouse, in Central Park, is life-changing; thecentralparkboathouse. com .) You get to see NYC’s trendiest restaurants. Try to book a dinner table at tiny Buvette, in the West Village, and the bistro’s manager will laugh down the phone. But go at 8am and you’ll have your pick of tables. Order the waffle sandwich, with fried egg, bacon, melted gruyère and maple syrup ( buvette.com ).
Unhurried dining is another reason to eat out at breakfast. There can be long lines
